alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 6:09PM MST until January 02 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW OVER THE PLAINS... .Snow, heavy at times, will continue over the plains through midnight and then slowly decrease. Further west along the I-25 Corridor and across the higher terrain light snow will continue this evening before ending around midnight. Some light freezing drizzle may occur at lower elevations. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow ongoing with light freezing drizzle. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...Fort Collins, and Greeley. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Icy roads will make travel very difficult to impossible. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County
